title: Shipwreck
summary: A shipwreck is the wreckage of a ship that is located either beached on land or sunken to the bottom of a body of water. Shipwrecking may be intentional or unintentional. Angela Croome reported in January 1999 that there were approximately three million shipwrecks worldwide[1] (an estimate rapidly endorsed by UNESCO[2][3] and other organizations[4]).
